newsitem.title: USA: AMCOL core segments improve in Q1.
newsitem.headline: AMCOL core segments improve in Q1.

text.p: AMCOL International Corp said Monday results for the first quarter showed improvement over year-ago earnings due to better performances in each of its core segments.

"Each of our core segments -- absorbent polymers, minerals and environmental -- reported higher sales and operating profits in year-over-year first quarter comparisons," John Hughes, president, said in a statement.
Earlier, AMCOL reported first quarter earnings of $0.16 a share, up from $0.06 a year ago. Sales rose to $107.9 million from $85.5 million.
Absorbent polymers, representing approximately 43 percent of net sales for the quarter, saw a 41 percent increase in sales to $45.2 million and a 71 percent rise in operating profit to $6.6 million.
The minerals segment, which accounted for approximately 36 percent of net sales, had a 14 percent rise in sales to $39.3 million and an operating profit that more than doubled to $2.2 million.

The environmental segment posted a 20 percent rise in sales to $16.6 million and a 31 percent higher operating profit of $929,000. Transportation operations saw a 34 percent rise in sales to $6.9 million and a 38 percent gain in operating profit to $371,000.
Hughes added that the company's newest area, nanocomposites, remains promising.

"We continue to make important strides toward the start-up of a commercial facility in Aberdeen, Miss., during the third quarter of 1997," Hughes said. "Initially, this facility will be producing a high-purity clay suitable for inclusion in various commercial plastics. While we look for some sales of the product in 1997, we anticipate that we will not reach gross profit break-even until some time in 1998."
